pr.title: UCMS-20020: Author Profile V2 into its own RC

expected_findings.description: The `email` field is not queried in `guestAuthor`. The `AuthorProfileContact` component checks `author.email` to render a mailto link, and the `AuthorProfile` component checks `author.email` for contact section visibility. Without querying `email`, it will always be `undefined` in production, and the email social link will never render.

The component uses rest destructuring `({ children, ...adsProps })` but its propTypes and defaultProps define `adsProps` as a named prop. This means ALL non-children props are spread into `<Ads>` as individual props. The `adsProps` entry in `defaultProps` is dead code since it's never destructured as a named prop.

The comment says 'component uses title, not jobTitle' but the component (`AuthorProfileHeader` line 55) actually reads `author.jobTitle`. The `authorWithTitle` stub creates a `title` property while `jobTitle` is inherited from the `author` spread. The header test creates `{ ...englishAuthor, title: undefined }` to test 'no title' but doesn't clear `jobTitle`, so the component still renders the job title - the test doesn't validate what it describes.

The propTypes declare `title: PropTypes.string` but the component never uses `author.title` - it passes the author object to `AuthorProfileHeader` which reads `author.jobTitle`. This should be `jobTitle: PropTypes.string` to match the actual data contract.

The component destructures `config.get('authorProfileImage')` without any null guard. If a client configuration doesn't include `authorProfileImage` (only AJA and AJE configs add it), this will throw `Cannot destructure property 'sizes' of undefined`.

PropTypes declares `avatars: PropTypes.oneOfType([PropTypes.array, PropTypes.object])` suggesting object format is supported, but `getAvatarUrlOfForcedSize` explicitly rejects non-array avatars and returns a placeholder. Either remove `PropTypes.object` from the type to make the contract honest, or handle the object format in the avatar helper.

The component uses `useIsMobile()` which returns `false` during SSR but may return `true` on the client. This causes a hydration mismatch where the server renders a `carousel` layout but the client switches to `mobileGrid` after hydration, causing a visible layout shift.

The section has both `aria-labelledby` and `aria-label`. When both are present, `aria-labelledby` takes precedence per WAI-ARIA spec, making `aria-label` redundant. This also applies to the contact and featured sections.
PropTypes for `tabs` doesn't require `headingId`, so a custom tab without `headingId` would create `href='#undefined'`.

The `CarouselArticleCard` component now accepts `...props` and spreads them into `CardArticle`. Uncontrolled prop spreading can lead to unexpected behavior if callers accidentally pass props that conflict with the hardcoded defaults.

The `createGuestAuthor` mock helper doesn't include the `email` field. The mock data in tests won't reflect the real GraphQL response shape, potentially masking issues where `email` is expected but not present.

When `articles` is empty but `guestAuthor` exists, the page returns `<NotFound />`. This means an author who has a valid profile but zero published articles will show a 404 page instead of their profile.
